page.title: 09Recreation Ground
page.content:
{ The playground,}which was built by local volunteers (map ref. 336925), was opened on the 9th July 1983. The Silver Jubilee Fund and the Rawdon-Smith Trust in Coniston gave some money to buy the land and equipment.
At the time of writing there are 2 big swings and 2 low swings, a slide and 2 tunnels. There is also a big log and a wooden rabbit. The slide is the most popular with the children. There are 2 badminton courts and a rounders pitch.
The committee are hoping to buy a large new wooden climbing frame soon. They are also going to buy a hut to house the grass cutting machines; the grass is cut once a week in the summer by members of the committee.
